title: Software Engineering Intern
description:
Software Engineering Intern - Spring 2026 (Crunchy Tech) 

Crunchy Tech is looking for a driven and talented Computer Science or Computer Engineering student to join our team for a one-semester internship during the Spring 2026 term. This is an excellent opportunity for a student in their junior or senior year to gain hands-on experience in a fast-paced, innovative tech environment. 

 

About Crunchy Tech 

We are a leading technology firm specializing in B2B Audio Visual (AV) Solutions. At Crunchy Tech, we value innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning. Our interns are an essential part of our team, working on real-world projects that impactour products and customers. 

 

Position Details 

Role: Software Engineering Intern 

Duration: One Academic Semester (Spring 2026) 

Location: Remote 

Compensation: Hourly pay commensurate with experience and technical skill level 

 

What You'll Do 

As a Software Engineering Intern, you will be embedded within one of our core development teams. Your responsibilities may include: 

Contributing to the design, development, and testing of new features for our core applications. 

Writing clean, efficient, and well-documented code. 

Debugging and resolving issues in existing codebases. 

Participating in code reviews and team stand-up meetings. 

Collaborating with internal teams to define technical requirements. 

 

Qualifications 

Required 

Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a closely related technical field. 

Must be entering your Junior or Senior year in Spring 2026. 

Strong foundation in data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented programming (OOP) principles. 

Experience with at least one major programming language (e.g., Python, C++, Java). 

Excellent problem-solving skills and a strong desire to learn. 

Preferred (Bonus Points!) 

Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, Zoho). 

Prior experience with version control systems, especially Git. 

Familiarity with agile development methodologies. 

A personal project, open-source contribution, or substantial coursework demonstrating coding proficiency. 

 

How to Apply 

Please submit your resume, transcript (unofficial is acceptable), and a brief cover letter explaining your interest in Crunchy Tech and your relevant coursework/projects. 

Application Deadline: January 15th 2026 

Crunchy Tech is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals. 

 

Ready to crunch some code with us? Apply today!
